column4: How can I mount an external HD via USb when it's not recognised?
it used to do it automatically under Dapper, but not apparently with edgy...
Make it become  recognised. Do 'tail -f   /var/log/messages' and stick the drive in (only use the back usb ports at the moment)
after you plug it in 'dmesg' should have 'sdd1' or sda1 or something.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/30678/ is the output from dmesg
Right. Doesn't like it.
no, it doesn't. And I don't know why. Ironically; it has all my pre-upgrade backups on it... not good news
HDD is it? Powered?
yeah, a IDE HD in a box, powered, even ventilated
no ideas to mount this rather inconsiderate (replace last words by a big bad 4 letter...) HD?
modprobe -l |grep hci
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/30681/
'lsmod |grep hci
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/30683
I can't think of why it's not finding it. You are trying in the back usb ports right?
yup, and I've tried in several different ports, just in case
do you reckon that a clean edgy reinstall would help?
because otherwise it's a clean Dapper reinstall, dammit!
Shouldn't need to. But I can't think of options at the moment.
the external drive has *all* my data on it, and i sort of need it...
of course.
